casebody.data:
Case No. 2,091. BUCKLEY v. BEATTY. [1 Cranch, C. C. 245.]1 Circuit Court, District of Columbia. July Term, 1805. Suit against Administbatob — Defenses. Administrators are bound to plead before the expiration of a year, from the date of the letters of administration. Rule to plead. Objection overruled. By the law of Mary*566land, an administrator is not bound' to plead plene administravit. See the case of Frazier y. Brackenridge. [Case No. 5,071].

[Reported by Hon. William Cranch, Chief Judge.]

Mr. Key, for defendant,

objected to pleading, as twelve months had not expired since the death of the intestate. He cannot plead plene administravit, because not bound to pay any debts until twelve months after, &c.
